CRITICS.Definition: people who say that they don't approve of something or that they find it wrong

UNBIASED.Definition: not likely to support one particular group, fair

UPSTATE.Definition: towards the northern part of the state

MORTGAGE.Definition: the amount of money borrowed from a bank in order to buy a property

PREACHING.Definition: supporting and teaching a religious belief

KNEELING DOWN.Definition: going down on both knees to show obedience and to pray

STRAYED.Definition: moved away from the right course

EYE WITNESSES.Definition: people who claimed they had seen the event with their own eyes

OVERSTATEMENT.Definition: the act of describing something as more important than it really is

COLLOQUIALLY.Definition: informally, in the language of everyday conversation

MANIFESTATION.Definition: something that clearly showed what Christianity is

UNIQUELY.Definition: being the only one of its type

TWIST.Definition: an unusual, different feature of something

SACRILEGIOUS.Definition: something that doesn't show respect to something that is considered holy

HERESY.Definition: a belief that goes against the official or popular religion system

MADMAN.Definition: someone who behaves in a strange way, crazy

FRAUD.Definition: someone who tries to achieve personal gain by telling lies

CULT-LEADER.Definition: a leader of a secret and suspicious organisation

ACCUSATIONS.Definition: claims that he had done something wrong

RIFTS.Definition: breaks in friendly and good relations

POLYGAMY.Definition: the fact of a person having multiple husbands or wives

INSISTENCE.Definition: the fact of insisting on something and refusing to accept other opinions

MARTYR.Definition: a person who is killed because of their beliefs

DENSITY.Definition: the quantity of people in a given area

LEAFLETS.Definition: pieces of paper that advertise something

GAMBLING.Definition: playing games of luck in order to get money

ENCOURAGING.Definition: trying to make someone do something

TITHING.Definition: the practice of giving 10% of your income to the church

EXCESSIVE.Definition: more than what is normal or acceptable

RECRUITS.Definition: people who were convinced to follow

DISCOURAGED.Definition: tried to make someone not to do something

CONTRACEPTION.Definition: the use of methods intended to prevent women from becoming pregnant

MISCONCEPTION.Definition: an incorrect view or opinion because it's based on wrong understanding

IN THE PUBLIC EYE.Definition: the state of being known to people in general

ARTICULATE.Definition: having the quality to speak fluently and clearly

OUT OF PRINCIPLE.Definition: based on their ideas and beliefs

APPROACHABLE.Definition: friendly and easy to talk to

STRICT.Definition: limiting someone's freedom to behave as they wish

WHISTLEBLOWER.Definition: someone who reports a suspicious or wrong activity

AMASS.Definition: gather a large amount of something
